title: Dominant ARF3 variants disrupt Golgi integrity and cause a neurodevelopmental disorder recapitulated in zebrafish
description: Disruptions to the ER-Golgi network can lead to neurodevelopmental disorders, though our understanding of these Golgipathies remains incomplete. Here Lauri, Tartaglia and colleagues show thatARF3mutations cause a rare pediatric neurological disorder and perform detailed molecular characterization in fish.
authors: nature, search, Giulia Fasano, Valentina Muto, Marco Tartaglia, Maarten H. Geurts, Hans Clevers, A. Porrazzo, F. Cipressa, G. Cenci, Monika Horazna, Lucie Janeckova, Vladimir Korinek, Ruben Daum, Eva M. Brauchle, Katja Schenke-Layland, Sharon M. Kolk, Pasko Rakic

title: CRISPR engineering in organoids for gene repair and disease modelling
description: Adult stem cell-derived organoids closely resemble their tissue of origin. This Review discusses recent developments in CRISPR-mediated genome engineering and its application using adult-stem-cell-derived organoids in the construction of isogenic disease models and for clinical gene repair.
authors: nature, search, Giulia Fasano, Valentina Muto, Marco Tartaglia, Maarten H. Geurts, Hans Clevers, A. Porrazzo, F. Cipressa, G. Cenci, Monika Horazna, Lucie Janeckova, Vladimir Korinek, Ruben Daum, Eva M. Brauchle, Katja Schenke-Layland, Sharon M. Kolk, Pasko Rakic

title: Low dose rate γ-irradiation protects fruit fly chromosomes from double strand breaks and telomere fusions by reducing the esi-RNA biogenesis factor Loquacious
description: Chronic low y-radiation exposure toDrosophilacells decreases chromosome breaks induced by high-dose irradiation and telomere dysfunction by reducing the esiRNA biogenesis factor Loquacious D.
authors: nature, search, Giulia Fasano, Valentina Muto, Marco Tartaglia, Maarten H. Geurts, Hans Clevers, A. Porrazzo, F. Cipressa, G. Cenci, Monika Horazna, Lucie Janeckova, Vladimir Korinek, Ruben Daum, Eva M. Brauchle, Katja Schenke-Layland, Sharon M. Kolk, Pasko Rakic
